result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn A Luckette

records.addlTxt: Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires: January 9, 2023.
Defendant's Motion for Bail Modification.  (Shawn A. Luckette - #2022003678, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Shawn A Luckette not in court, in custody.  Attorney Marcella De Peters in court for Shawn A Luckette. Defendant's appearance waived.   Prosecuting attorney Chad Wozniak in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting an adjourned trial date.  Discussion held on the record.  The Court granted request and vacated the  scheduled trial date of 9/26 and ordered new dates for final  pre trial and jury trial.  Court advised parties to file any pretrial motions, witness lists 48 hours prior to the date of final pre trial.    Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Motion to adjourn jury trial, filed.

Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Shawn A Luckette not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discovery issues need to be addressed by parties.  Case is adjourned for a final pretrial in Br 45.  mn  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Witness List.pdf, Filed.
State's Motion in Limine.pdf, Filed.
State's Notice of Expert Testimony.pdf, Filed.
State's Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence.pdf, Filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (42 pages) commencing 04-18-2022 by Kathleen S. Worden.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB

Attorney Marcella DePeters in court, defendant Shawn A Luckette not in court, in custody, CJF; appearance waived.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discovery under review.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:45 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Marcella Depeters in person, defendant Shawn A Luckette, in custody, CJF via Zoom.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared via Zoomfor the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel awaiting discovery from previous attorney.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
re substitution
cover letter

Defendant Shawn A Luckette in court with attorney Michael J Steinle in person.  Defendant in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminay hearing.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD  Detective James Jordan.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court, defendant Shawn A Luckette not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video means due to Covid-19 protocol.
Matter in court for preliminary hearing. Attorney Steinle has just been retained and needs time to review case with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 032403,
Payable Number: 997643,
Receipt Number: 22RP013784,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shawn A Luckette in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Shawn A Luckette in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shawn A Luckette appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
